snippet: Scientists conducted "computer modeling of a nuclear explosive device,” according to the report, which does not say if Iran made a complete blueprint for a bomb.
abstract: International Atomic Energy Agency issues report, required by recently signed nuclear accord, concluding Iran made no significant progress towards producing viable nuclear weapon; discovery of attempts to design weapon as late as 2009, and Iranian officials' refusal to answer several key questions, sets troubling precedent for transparency.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Vienna, and William J. Broad from New York.

lead_paragraph: Scientists conducted "computer modeling of a nuclear explosive device,” according to the report, which does not say if Iran made a complete blueprint for a bomb.

headline.main: Nuclear Agency Says Iran Worked on Weapons Design Until 2009
headline.print_headline: U.N. Nuclear Agency Says Iran Worked on Weapons Design Until 2009
